page.title: 09CURRIE BANK
page.content: We interviewed Mr.A, the assistant accountant at the Royal Bank of Scotland. He told us that he took the job because it was a step on the ladder of promotion. He enjoys his work but sometimes he gets bored. He had to get special training and has been working in the bank for three years now. He starts work at 9.00am and finishes at 5.00pm. He works five days a week and gets 25 days of holidays a year. Machines are used to count the money in the bank and at the moment there is about 50-60 thousand pounds in the vault. The building has been there for sixteen years now, and the "Cashline" machine for six years. The bank's sign shows arrows pointing into a circle, which represents money coming into the banking circle. Mr.A Lives nearby but still drives to work. He enjoys sport,gardening and reading.
